Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Regards,
Kim

input_text:
Email 1: Hi James, Looking to move 5,8kmt of palm kernel oil from Port Klang to Male. Can you advise how the refrigeration is done in the holds. Cheers, Mona Email 2: Dear Mona, The refrigeration is done by ventilation - the holds are ventilated by system that draws air through ice cold seawater. The air is then used to keep the goods at right temperature. There is no refrigeration in the holds of our ships. In between, there are rooms for packages of bulk goods. We could load the PKE in these rooms. It should fit in one or two such rooms. The loading rate would be 7-8t per hour. The max weight per carcase is 1.500kg. The container could not handle heavier carcases. To prevent damage of the PKE during loading, we have made special arrangements for the loading. The shell of the PKE must be closed after being loaded and we suggest using special sealing material for this purpose. A sample of this material can be sent if you wish. Should you Email 3: Hi James, That sounds good. I can arrange the product to arrive in 20 ft containers. The dimensions are as follows: The biggest one is 140cm x 75cm x 37cm and the heaviest is 1270kgs. We need 5 containers. I can arrange the sealing material, do you have the dimensions of the rooms you have in mind? Thanks again. Mona Email 4: Dear Mona, The rooms are about 8,5m by 2,9m, 2,8m high. That should be sufficient. A container is the best to move it. We have also made arrangements for transporting the PKE in ISO containers. If you have difficulties to do so, we could also load the goods at our port in Port Klang, moving the goods in our own trucks from there. Should you have further questions, please let me know. Best regards, James Kleine
Managing Director, Kleine Business Consultancy
Maritima Massey Building
41 Massey Road
Sandton
2196
Johannesburg
+27 (11) 684-3387
+27 (83) 322-5294 (mobile)
kleine@net
output_text:
From: mona@example.com
To: james.kleine@kleinebusinessconsultancy.com
Subject: Request for Shipping Information on Palm Kernel Oil
Timestamp: 2023-02-01 09:34
Body: Hi James,

I'm looking to ship approximately 5800 metric tons of palm kernel oil from Port Klang to Male. Could you provide details on how refrigeration is managed during transport? Our product requires specific temperature conditions.

Cheers,
Mona

---

From: james.kleine@kleinebusinessconsultancy.com
To: mona@example.com
Subject: Re: Request for Shipping Information on Palm Kernel Oil
Timestamp: 2023-02-01 15:20
Body: Dear Mona,

Thank you for reaching out. Our vessels manage temperature-sensitive cargo like palm kernel oil using ventilated holds. The ventilation system cools the air via ice-cold seawater and circulates it to keep the cargo at the required temperature. Unfortunately, there are no dedicated refrigeration units in the holds.

We can load the palm kernel oil in ventilated rooms suitable for package or bulk goods. These rooms can accommodate one or two containers, with a loading rate of 7-8 tons per hour and a maximum weight limit of 1500 kg per container.

Special arrangements for loading to prevent damage to the palm kernel oil will include sealed containers. We can provide a sample of the required sealing material if needed.

Best regards,
James Kleine
Managing Director
Kleine Business Consultancy

---

From: mona@example.com
To: james.kleine@kleinebusinessconsultancy.com
Subject: Re: Request for Shipping Information on Palm Kernel Oil
Timestamp: 2023-02-02 10:15
Body: Hi James,

That sounds good. I plan to arrange the product arrival in 20 ft containers. The largest container dimensions are 140cm x 75cm x 37cm, with the heaviest weighing 1270 kg. We will need space for 5 containers. Could you please provide the dimensions of the available rooms?

Thanks again.
Mona

---

From: james.kleine@kleinebusinessconsultancy.com
To: mona@example.com
Subject: Re: Request for Shipping Information on Palm Kernel Oil
Timestamp: 2023-02-02 14:45
Body: Dear Mona,

The available rooms for shipping are approximately 8.5m long, 2.9m wide, and 2.8m high. This should be sufficient for your 20 ft containers. We have arrangements to transport palm kernel oil in ISO containers efficiently.

If you encounter any issues with container arrangement, we can facilitate loading at Port Klang using our own trucks.

Please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Best regards,
James Kleine
Managing Director
Kleine Business Consultancy
Maritima Massey Building
41 Massey Road
Sandton
2196
Johannesburg
+27 (11) 684-3387
+27 (83) 322-5294 (mobile)
kleine@net

input_text:
Email 1:
Matthieu,                    We'd like to ship 8,000MT of pyrophyllite ore from Aqaba to Mombasa next month. Could you let us know your best freight rate and vessel name for this shipment?                    Best regards,                    Ralph
Email 2:
Hi Ralph,
Thanks for your inquiry. We are pleased to quote for this shipment as follows:
Vessel: XING LING
Sailing from: Qingdao on or about March 28, 2009
ETA: Mombasa on or about April 11, 2009
US$ 200/MT for a container load on FOB basis
US$ 180/MT for a container load on CIF basis
Above rate includes
a) the freighting by vessel
b) cost of berthing of vessel at Mombasa
c) payment of standard port charges (for clearance and handling of goods)
d) payment of cost of container
e) our usual agency fee
Please note that the rate above does not include following charges
a) cost of shipment of goods from Suez to Qingdao
b) cost of shipment of goods from Qingdao
Email 3:
Hi Phil,
Thanks for your reply.
This is what the customer wants:

·      We prefer to ship to Mombasa in containers. We can buy these in
Qingdao.

·      We require door-to-door service. Our agent will take care of all
port handling in China, the inland transportation of the containers to
the door in Mombasa and collection of goods at the door after
discharge.

·      We prefer to arrange shipment and freight payment ourselves.

·      Can you arrange the above service on a CIF basis, i.e. we would

Email 2:

Another example:

Email 1:
What’s your best price for shipment of 2,000 MT of 2,2,4-Trimethylpentane from Singapore to Hamburg, and can you provide vessel details for that route?                    Thank you,                    Ella

<Email 2>:

I would like to have the vessel details for the voyage. How about FOB and CFR? Best,                  Ella

And still another:

Email 1:
Hi, could you please provide your best rate for shipment of 2,000 MT of 2,2,4-Trimethylpentane from Singapore to Hamburg, and can you provide vessel
Email 3:
That price is the only price I have, I will not go lower.
Could you please provide the vessel details for the voyage? Best,                  Ella
Email 4:
I would like to have the vessel details for the voyage. How about FOB and CFR? Best,                  Ella

If you look at the exchanges above, you’ll note the common themes. Firstly, each of these sets of emails contains the same issue: a cargo shipment price inquiry with vessel and shipping details requested. Secondly, we see, in nearly every single instance, the respondent adding a short and terse phrase at the end of the first reply, as follows:
“I would like to have the vessel details for the voyage. How about FOB and CFR? Best,                  Ella”

There is another small issue: the unvarying second email address (ella(@)marketmanager.de). Using the email header information, this address is seen to have been used by the same person to send all emails to the parties in the test sample. There is also a strong suspicion that this address is a
Email 5:

input_text:
Email 1:
We are looking for a voyage from October 25th to 28th for 26,000MT.                    Best regards,                    Gavin
Email 2:
We are looking for a voyage from October 25th to 28th for 26,000MT.                   Best regards,                   Gavin


## Reference number

Not present

## Vocabulary (1)

- **10k** 10,000
- **.5** 1/2, half

## Adverbs

**On** **October 25th**
Email 3:
Dear Madame/Sir
We are looking for a voyage from October 25th to 28th for 26,000MT.

To **be looking** **for** a voyage

To **do** something, the subject is doing, the action. 

Compare:
To **be** waiting for a friend.

We are looking for a voyage means that they need someone to buy their product.  

One must use the passive for this sentence. 
We have the object in the sentence - voyage.  This can be changed to object of the preposition **for** - voyage **for**.  
This change turns the whole sentence into the passive sentence.

The subject will be the preposition. 
We know this because the preposition **for** comes before the subject.  We can make it **a voyage**.

We are **looking** for **a voyage**

The question is
Email 4:
**Who** are **looking** **for** **a voyage**

Answer **They** are looking for a voyage. 

## Common mistake in student papers

1. Using the active form for these sentences.  

We do not use the active form when there is a preposition after the subject.  
It should be  
**He** is looking **for** a house. 
We have the active form **He** is looking, but **for** comes after it.
We change the active form to the passive form, thus creating the passive form.

**There** is looking **for** a house.

2. Removing the article. 

The article **a** is required to make the sentence active.  
**He** is looking **for** a house.  
If you remove **a**, you have created a passive sentence.

<Email 4>:
**Who** is looking

input_text:
Email 1:
Hi Alice,                    I was wondering if your charter is open for 1,500MT of fertilizer from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur.                    Best regards,                    Bryan
Email 2:
Hi Alice,                    I'm sorry but I do not think my email went through. I have a buyer for your cargoes and the prices they offered are too good to pass up. Please let me know if your charter is still open for the 1500MT of fertilizer going from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur.                    Best regards,                    Bryan

1.              Email 1's real purpose:
1)         Determine whether the charter is open.
2)         Determine whether Alice would accept a low offer.
3)         Determine if buyer is legitimate. If not, waste time with Alice.
2.              Email 2's real purpose:
1)         Determine whether the charter is still open.
3.              How to improve your negotiation process.
1)         Understand that the recipient of a letter/email is also trying to figure out the real reason behind your writing them.
2)         State the true
Email 3:
Hi Alice,
         The charter is not open yet, so I think the email went through. However, I would still like to find out more about the buyer so that we can determine if he's legit. Could you please tell me more about him?
Best regards,
Bryan

1.              Email 3's purpose:
1)         Clarify the truth. (Was Alice even considering the offer?)
2)         Get some insight into the buyer. (How do I know he's legit?)

2.              How to improve your negotiation process:
1)         Do not ask more than one question per email.

<Email 4>:
Hi Bryan,
         Well, yes, I'm sorry I won't be considering your offer. That doesn't mean you can't have the charter though. I just need to check a few things out first. I think you mentioned something about the buyer

2.              How to improve your negotiation process:

Dear Ms. Davis,                    We have 5,000MT of fertiliser from Charleston to San Francisco. Can you let me know if you have a vessel free in the next week, and what your standard demurrage rate is?                    Kind regards,                    Peter
Email 2:
Dear Peter,

I am pleased to say we do indeed have a vessel free at the time you have requested for 5,000MT. Our current standard demurrage rate is $200 per day, for no more than 7 days, or 5,000 per month. Is this acceptable?                    Kind regards,                    Jessica
output_text:
From: peter@example.com
To: jessica.davis@example.com
Subject: Availability and Demurrage Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment
Timestamp: 2023-11-01 09:32
Body: Dear Ms. Davis,

We have a requirement to ship 5,000MT of fertilizer from Charleston to San Francisco. Could you please let me know if you have a vessel available in the next week, as well as your standard demurrage rates?

Kind regards,
Peter

---

From: jessica.davis@example.com
To: peter@example.com
Subject: Re: Availability and Demurrage Inquiry for Fertilizer Shipment
Timestamp: 2023-11-01 11:45
Body: Dear Peter,

I am pleased to inform you that we have a vessel available for your specified shipment timeframe. Our standard demurrage rate is $200 per day for a maximum of 7 days, or $5,000 per month.

Please let me know if this is acceptable to you or if you need further information.

Kind regards,
Jessica

What is the sentiment analysis for these emails? The sentiment analysis can be achieved by applying a process which determines whether the tone of a piece of text is positive, negative or neutral. The email sentiment analysis API is an application programming interface (API) used to determine the sentiment of a piece of text by returning a number between 0 and 1, where 1 is positive and 0 is negative. The output of this API can be either 1, 0 or 0.5, which implies either positive, negative or neutral sentiment respectively. The input of the API is text and the output can be used in
Email 3:

0.3333333333333333

The sentiment score of email 1 is 0.5 and that of email 2 is 0.3333, which means they are both neutral and contain the same sentiment. The positive sentiment is determined from the use of words such as "Good" and "Regards", while the negative sentiment is determined from the use of words such as "still" and "need". The last email is neutral and contains no sentiment. However, the sentiment score of the first email is higher than that of the second one because it contains more positive words. Email 1:
Hello Mr. Yamaguchi,                    Could you handle 3,700MT of methanol from Hamriyah to Mumbai this weekend?                    Also, do you anticipate any demurrage beyond 48 hours of laytime?                    Best,                    Suraj
Email 2:
Hello Mr. Yamaguchi,                    What was the shortest demurrage encountered by your vessel between 20 January - 3 February 2018?                    Best,                    Suraj
Email 3:
No llychae [sic] doc. No "lowest demurrage" so sorry
May tank. Transp: 3,700 MT methanol F/Mumbai 20/1/2018
Sailed 23/1/2018 7:30 hrs from Sharjah.
Approx 5 hrs demurrage in Dubai: http://goo.gl/maps/PgmWT
Demurrage will be minimum and all as per MSA
Best,
output_text:
From: suraj@example.com
To: yamaguchi@example.com
Subject: Inquiry about Methanol Shipment Handling Capacity
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 09:00
Body: Hello Mr. Yamaguchi,
Could you handle 3,700MT of methanol from Hamriyah to Mumbai this weekend? Also, do you anticipate any demurrage charges beyond 48 hours of laytime?
Best,
Suraj

---

From: suraj@example.com
To: yamaguchi@example.com
Subject: Query on Historical Demurrage Data
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 09:30
Body: Hello Mr. Yamaguchi,
What was the shortest demurrage duration encountered by your vessel between January 20 to February 3, 2018?
Best,
Suraj

---

From: yamaguchi@example.com
To: suraj@example.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry about Methanol Shipment Handling Capacity and Historical Demurrage Data
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 10:15
Body: Dear Suraj,
Unfortunately, I do not have a specific document for the "lowest demurrage", but I can inform you about a relevant instance. Our vessel once transported 3,700 MT of methanol from Sharjah to Mumbai on January 20, 2018. It sailed at 7:30 AM on January 23, 2018, from Sharjah and had approximately 5 hours of demurrage in Dubai. You can view the location here: http://goo.gl/maps/PgmWT

For the upcoming shipment, demurrage will be minimal and all terms will adhere strictly to the Maritime Service Agreement (MSA).

Best regards,
Yamaguchi

input_text:
Email 1:
Dear Mr. Happy,                    I would like to place an order for 12,000MT of sugar from Asia to Europe. Please advise on available vessels, and I will get back to you.                    Best regards,                    Tanisha
Email 2:
Dear Tanisha,

I have an available vessel which will be ready on 19th October. Loading is ready at Singapore and discharge is ready at an Amsterdam port.

Please see my terms for this shipment. 40% of the price is payable at the time of signing the agreement and the balance upon delivery. I will wait for your kind confirmation.

Best Regards,
Rami

<Email 3>:
Dear Rami,

I will like to receive an official offer.  What are the details of this offer?

Best regards,
Tanisha
Email 3:
Dear Rami,

I will like to receive an official offer.  What are the details of this offer?

Best regards,
Tanisha

<Email 3>:
 Dear Tanisha,

I would like to confirm the price is $840/MT for CIF Amsterdam and L/C will be issued on 1 November 2011. Payment will be made at the time of the agreement and the balance upon delivery. I would also like to know which vessel is available to move the cargo? Best Regards, Rami <Email 3> Dear Tanisha, If you would be sending me a signed copy of the agreement then I will give you all the details. The rest can be filled at the time of delivery. Payment will be made at the time of the agreement and the balance upon delivery. The vessel which will be available for your cargo is MV Eleftheria. Best Regards, Rami
output_text:

Subject: Inquiry for Sugar Shipment from Asia to Europe
Timestamp: 2023-10-05 09:30
Body: Dear Mr. Happy,

I would like to place an order for 12,000MT of sugar from Asia to Europe. Could you please advise on available vessels? I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
Tanisha

---

From: rami@shippingco.com
To: tanisha@example.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry for Sugar Shipment from Asia to Europe
Timestamp: 2023-10-06 10:15
Body: Dear Tanisha,

Thank you for your inquiry. We have a vessel available that will be ready on 19th October. Loading will commence at Singapore and discharge at Amsterdam Port.

Please review my terms for this shipment. 40% of the price is payable at the time of signing the agreement and the balance upon delivery. I await your confirmation.

Best Regards,
Rami

---

From: tanisha@example.com
To: rami@shippingco.com
Subject: Request for Official Offer and Details
Timestamp: 2023-10-07 08:45
Body: Dear Rami,

I would like to receive an official offer. Could you please provide the details of the terms and the vessel?

Tanisha

Body: Dear Tanisha,

I confirm the price at $840/MT for CIF Amsterdam. Payment terms are as follows: 40% payable at the time of the agreement and the balance upon delivery. The L/C will be issued on 1st November 2023. The vessel available for your cargo is MV Eleftheria.

Upon receipt of a signed copy of the agreement, I will provide additional details as required.

Best Regards,
Rami

input_text:
Email 1:
Good morning Ms. Saha,                    Our client would like to ship 4.6t kmt of refined palm oil from Belawan to Dalian, and possibly more. Are there any slots available during the first week of April, and what rate are you quoting?                    Thanks,                    Lyn
Email 2:
Good morning Ms. Saha,              Thanks for your email. This is more details about the shipment.              Our customer would like to ship 3.8t kmt of refined palm oil from Belawan to Dalian, loading at end of March, and destination agent is  Beijing Huaxia Weilai International Commerce Co., Ltd.          Let us know if this is possible, and what rate are you quoting.              Thanks,                    Lyn

Attachments:

:                 <Attachment>

1 is not contained in 2 and vice versa. Hence, CQP (and thus ALL) return the set of 5 elements.

Notion:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Obtain 2 text files with a string “s1” and “s2” as above. Let’s assume s1 and s2 are not common strings.
\item Develop a program that accepts these
Email 3:
<Email 4>:
First, download these two text files:
\end{enumerate}

• Data 1: a.txt
• Data 2: b.txt

Second, from the data, find whether email 1 is contained in email 2 and vice versa. If email 1 is contained in email 2, answer YES; if not, answer NO.

\begin{enumerate}
\item Note: the order of word in emails does not matter.
\end{enumerate}

Last edited: 2021-01-08, 17:33

### 4_Week06_2f:

Run as follows:
\$ python word_match.py a.txt b.txt

Output:
YES
output_text:
From: lyn@shippingco.com
To: saha@freightbrokerage.com
Subject: Shipping Enquiry: Refined Palm Oil from Belawan to Dalian
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 08:30
Body: Good morning Ms. Saha,

Our client would like to ship 4.6 thousand metric tons (kmt) of refined palm oil from Belawan to Dalian, focusing on early April for loading. Could you please let us know if you have any slots available during the first week of April? Also, what would be the rate for this shipment?

Thanks,
Lyn

---

From: lyn@shippingco.com
To: saha@freightbrokerage.com
Subject: Additional Details: Shipment of Refined Palm Oil to Dalian
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 09:15
Body: Good morning Ms. Saha,

Thank you for attending to our previous email. I'd like to add that our customer now plans to ship a slightly adjusted amount of 3.8 thousand metric tons (kmt) of refined palm oil, with loading at the end of March. The destination agent will be Beijing Huaxia Weilai International Commerce Co., Ltd. Please confirm if this adjusted schedule and details are feasible and inform us of the revised rate.

Thanks,
Lyn

Email 1:
Hi Dr. Nakamura,                    We have 5,000 metric tons of wheat in Ashdod and are looking to ship it to Karachi. Could you send us the full shipping schedule for May? Also could you give us your best quote to ship that date?                    Best,                    Gracie
Email 2:
Hi Gracie,
Thanks for your inquiry. Can you send me your complete address with postal codes?
<Email 3>:
Hi, our address is: Unilever Pakistan Limited, "OPP Tower", 
State Life Building No.1, 2nd Floor, Abdullah Haroon Road, 
M.A. Jinnah Road, Karachi, 74000 Pakistan.

Thank you very much!
Email 3:
Hi, our address is: Unilever Pakistan Limited, "OPP Tower", 
State Life Building No.1, 2nd Floor, Abdullah Haroon Road, 
M.A. Jinnah Road, Karachi, 74000 Pakistan.

Thank you very much!

<Email 3>:
 Hi, our address is: Unilever Pakistan Limited, "OPP Tower", 
State Life Building No.1, 2nd Floor, Abdullah Haroon Road, 
M.A. Jinnah Road, Karachi, 74000 Pakistan.

Thank you very much!

Hi Dr. Nakamura,
The shipping details we're looking at were for May. Are you looking at other dates?
Gracie

Hi Gracie,
Thank you for your email. I will wait for your reply.

This snippet represents two separate emails. The first emails are typical types of emails in any trade conversation. They represent the customer asking for the shipping schedule for May and for the best shipping quote for that date. In email 3, the customer sends the complete address.

The customer appears to have followed up again with an email to ask about a different date. Nakamura responds again by asking to wait for
Email 4:
Hi Gracie,
Thank you for your email. I will wait for your reply.

...[while Nakamura leaves for vacation. Nakamura's email box remains empty for a month, and she does not respond to Gracie's email.]

## 1 Answer

Nakamura would have followed up on the request as soon as possible; Nakamura was probably away on vacation for most of that time, so the email system was empty.

I think Nakamura could have sent an auto-responder or had her colleagues respond to email queries for her, while she was on vacation.

My job as a Process Safety Coordinator for a company operating in various Asian countries, I often have to send emails in Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Thai.  I’ve never needed to be away from my job for an extended period of time.

## Related questions

Why was the water not salinated in the aquarium

To: support@materialsprovider.com
Subject: Request for Assistance with Shoe Material Issues
Timestamp: 2023-09-20 08:30
Body: I’m looking for some help, and I was hoping you could point me in the right direction. I work for a company that produces orthopedic shoes, and we’ve been getting a lot of complaints about our shoes falling apart. It seems to happen whenever a patient uses our shoes to do a heavy activity, like basketball or soccer. Our shoes are made with the same materials as other brands, so I don’t understand why our shoes would be falling apart faster. I’m wondering if there’s something wrong with our manufacturing process, or if there’s some other reason that our shoes would be breaking more easily. Can you help me out?

Many thanks,
Jim

---

From: support@materialsprovider.com
To: jim.orthoshoe@shoeco.com
Subject: Re: Request for Assistance with Shoe Material Issues
Timestamp: 2023-09-20 10:15
Body: Dear Jim,

Thank you for reaching out and explaining the situation with your orthopedic shoes. It is concerning to hear that your shoes are deteriorating under heavy activities such as basketball or soccer. Even if the materials are the same as other brands, there could be numerous factors affecting the durability, from the quality of the input materials to the specific techniques used in your manufacturing process. We recommend conducting a thorough review of your entire production process and inspecting your material supplies. Additionally, consider whether these activities are recommended for the specific design of your orthopedic shoes.

Best regards,
Customer Support Team

Email 1:
Dear M. Adam,                    We're looking for a drybulk vessel on the US Gulf to Marmara, and I was wondering if you could advise on your next open laycan?                    Best regards,                    Jhovany
Email 2:
Good afternoon Jonathan,          I would like to let you know that I have a general cargo vessel for sale.        The vessel is 2014 built, 8,639 DWT, 8,412 GT, 5,690 NT.        Built by United Engineering  Corp., Korea.        Her cargo gear is 2 x fixed 120T at 19m reach.        Her total cargo capacity is 12,750 m3.        For more details please find the ship's main particulars below:                ______________________________________________________                LOA: 138.00 m        MPP: 00:00:00        Date of Build: 05/2014        BW: 12,013 m3        Total Fittings: 12,750 m3        SWL of gear: 120 t, 20 m        LPP: 130.00 m
Email 3:
Dear Jonathan,         I am inquiring regarding my vessel's next laycan, that is what is her planned availability in August, in that sense if you can advise.                    Regards,
Email 4:
Great A.,        I have the vessel not available in August, it is my pleasure to inform that I have the vessel available from mid August onwards. Please let me know if you need more information.        Kind Regards,        JG

The course of the entire communication can be summarized as follows:
• After a first contact with Jonathan, M. Adam informed him about an open laycan for one of his vessels
• Jhovany said that he was looking for a vessel for USG to Marmara for August
• Adam did not have an availability for that period, but rather stated that his vessel would be open from mid-August onward
• This led Jhovany to ask whether Jonathan could inform him as to how he would rework his whole portfolio, but Jonathan did not answer this question

It is interesting to note that all throughout the exchange the intended relationship between
Email 5:
Dear Jhovany,        I have the vessel available from mid August onwards. Please let me know if you need more information.        Kind Regards,        JG

Email 1:
Hi Mr. Meru,                    Do you have a suitable vessel for 5,000MT of DAP fertilizer from Karachi to Jeddah next week? ?                    Thank you,                    Mohammed
Email 2:
Hey Paul,                    got an offer from this guy who wants us to run a commission business between Pakistan and Jeddah. According to him this guy in Pakistan can get any commodities from Pakistan as they can buy them from factory (must be from buyer) and ship them to the middle east countries. My question is how safe is it for us to run a commission business as we don't know this person from Pakistan.                    You are more experienced than I am regarding that. I guess as long as we sign an agreement with the seller then we are covered.                    Can you advise me on that please?                    BTW, can you put me in touch with him as well so I can get to know him?                    He mentioned that they can ship fresh fruits, vegetables, meat and dairy products.                    Thank you,                    Fardos

<Email 3>
                            Hi Fardos
Email 3:
Hi Paul,

                            This person that is working with Mohammed is very professional, they can put you in touch with the person from Pakistan so you can come to terms with them and see if it is worth it or not.  Basically, they are looking to bring the fresh produce in from Pakistan to Jeddah and pay the charges to us.  They need it at a particular time of the year when Pakistan can supply the crops that are in season. The peak months would be April to September or so.  As you are in the meat business you may be able to get them deals and bring them in cheaply. The market is big there. I will contact you through Facebook as it will be better and you can find them in my friends list.

                            Do you have a suitable vessel for 5,000MT of DAP fertilizer from Karachi to Jeddah next week?

I received an offer regarding a commission business for transporting various commodities, including fresh fruits, vegetables, meat, and dairy products from Pakistan to the Middle East. The seller can source these goods directly from local factories. I need your advice on the safety and legal precautions of this arrangement, considering an unfamiliar contact. Could we also discuss setting up an agreement with the seller to secure our interests? Moreover, could you put me in touch with this contact for further discussion?

Thanks,
Fardos

---

From: paul@example.com
To: fardos@example.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry About Commission Business With New Contact
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 12:00
Body: Hi Fardos,

The contact working with Mohammed is professional and can facilitate your discussion with the supplier in Pakistan. This will help you to evaluate the terms and verify if the business proposition is beneficial. They aim to export perishable goods during peak months from April to September. Since you're engaged in the meat industry, there might be potential opportunities for you to source and ship these products cost-effectively. I'll connect with you on Facebook for further details, where you can also find the contact in my friend’s list.

Best,
Paul

Email 1:
Dear Friends,                    First of all I would like to thank everyone who has expressed their concern with the recent news that appeared in the press on 6th July regarding Mr. Abraham.  The news does not correspond to the reality and we have informed Mr. Abraham's lawyer about the necessary steps that should be taken to correct it.                    The court in New York has issued an interim order prohibiting the publisher from writing any further articles about Mr. Abraham in any newspapers, magazines or any other form of publication.                    Finally, I wish to thank you all again and to wish you all the best for your holiday,                                    Yours faithfully,                    Mr. Edmund Taylor

From: edmund.taylor@example.com
To: friends@example.com
Subject: Clearing Mr. Abraham's Reputation
Timestamp: 2023-07-07 08:30
Body: Dear Friends,
First of all, I would like to thank everyone who expressed their concern following the recent article about Mr. Abraham on 6th July. The portrayal in the media does not reflect reality, and we have notified Mr. Abraham's legal team to take appropriate steps to correct this misinformation. The New York court has already issued an interim order that prohibits the publisher from releasing further articles about Mr. Abraham in any form. Thank you all once again and best wishes for your holiday.
Yours faithfully,
Mr. Edmund Taylor

---

From: editor@irishexaminer.com
To: legal@irishexaminer.com
Subject: Fact-check Required: Article Misrepresentation Concern
Timestamp: 2023-07-07 12:15
Body: Dear Sir,
A recent article by Mr. Eoghan Rice titled 'Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release' published on 6 July, misrepresents facts about Mr. Maurice Abraham, who has been incarcerated in a U.S. federal prison for the past 5 years. The piece inaccurately reported that the person referred as 'H' and 'O’Toole' wrote the last two letters to 'The Irish Independent' just before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998. These were allegedly from Mr. Abraham. Furthermore, the article mentioned that Mr. Abraham’s communication privileges were revoked by prison authorities upon discovering his plans to write an exposé on tax fraud, which requires verification.
Best Regards.

---

From: legal@irishexaminer.com
To: editor@irishexaminer.com
Subject: Re: Fact-check Required: Article Misrepresentation Concern
Timestamp: 2023-07-07 14:50
Body: Dear Sir,
The information published by Mr. Eoghan Rice regarding Mr. Maurice Abraham appears to be partially investigated and potentially misleading. Mr. Rice's article claims activities and correspondences involving 'H' and 'O'Toole' that allegedly took place weeks before Stephen Trew’s 1998 murder, attributed to Mr. Abraham. Additional checks are necessary to validate these claims, especially regarding the alleged restriction of Mr. Abraham’s writing privileges by prison authorities.
Regards.

Email 1:
Dear Mr. García,                    Our customer is interested in chartering a medium-sized vessel to ship 6,000MT of rice from Manila to Lagos. Could you provide a sample contract with your typical terms and conditions?                    Thank you,                    Hector
Email 2:
Dear Sir,                    First of all, congratulations on your success and new position at Voyaca.com. I came across your profile on LinkedIn and found you very qualified to assist me in a very urgent matter.                    A few years ago, I employed a ship broker by the name of Brian Hopkin from Thomas Hopkin & Co to help charter a vessel to ship my company's produce from Panama to the West Coast of the USA.                    Unfortunately, a few days into the voyage, the vessel ran aground and was a total loss. Not only did Brian misrepresent his ship owner to be a reputable one, he went ahead and used me to sign up an insurance contract for his own personal benefit, under the influence of alcohol.                    He connived with the insurance company to release his profit after the ship sank but my company is still waiting for its share of the payout. Mr. Hopkin,
Email 3:
Dear Sir,                    At the time, I wasn't aware that he had so much experience in ship brokerage. I learned his dishonesty at the expense of my company. He had forged documents showing a photograph of the vessel to the owners before shipping and didn't tell me about his limited experience as an underwriter. Now I am having trouble recovering the costs of the cargo.                    Can you help me find a reliable ship broker to ship a product from Greece to Rotterdam? Can you advise on the best route, avoid legal and insurance mishaps, and ensure my company is protected against mishaps and liabilities?                    Thank you in advance for your assistance.
            Best regards,            Cieran
Response:
Hello Hector and Cieran,            Thank you for your enquiry.            Please find a draft of our Charter Party Terms & Conditions.            I would also like to suggest that Cieran contact a Ship Ins

Body: Dear Sir,

Congratulations on your recent success and new position at Voyaca.com. I came across your LinkedIn profile and believe you're well-suited to advise me in a pressing matter. Previously, I hired Brian Hopkin of Thomas Hopkin & Co for chartering a vessel to transport produce from Panama to the West Coast of the USA. The vessel unfortunately ran aground shortly after departure, resulting in a total loss. Brian misrepresented the ship owner's reputation and arranged an insurance policy to his advantage while under the influence of alcohol. He colluded with the insurance firm to secure his profit after the incident, but my company has yet to receive its share. 

I wonder if you might help me find a trustworthy ship broker for a new shipment from Greece to Rotterdam, and perhaps advise on the ideal route and legal safeguards to prevent further mishaps.

Thank you for your consideration.

Cieran

I hope this addresses both of your needs effectively.
Regards,
García

input_text:
Email 1:
Dear <Receiver>,                    Could you please let me know if you have any space in July for 1,400MT of rice from Houston to New York? The actual ETA is open, so I can arrange it in July if there is a possibility.                    Kind regards,                    Sridhar
Email 2:
Dear Sridhar,                 Do you still have any cargo from Houston to New York for June? I know it has passed, but I need a schedule in case July space is not available.                 Kind regards,                 Martin 

The agents can respond to each other immediately as they have all the necessary details for the booking in their possession and do not need to go back to their customers.

Since the offers from buyers and sellers are decentralized, they will not be able to negotiate prices and they will have to agree to the market price and then move on to the next negotiation.

If both agents reply to the sender with the same message, there will be an error because a double response is not allowed in TPN. Thus, there is a restriction against these situations to facilitate the tracking of pending operations.

In the third case, it is possible to get a counter-offer or a quote by the other

# @mentions
## Setup

We have the ability to mention people with @username. For example, mentioning @taylorotwell will notify Taylor Otwell that you mentioned them.

We use Laravel notifications internally, so if someone mentioned you and has their notification settings set up, they'll be notified of the mention.

To handle mentions in your own apps, simply listen for the Event:NotificationEvent which is sent when @mentions are posted.

See the Notifications documentation for more information.

# Text Formatting
#### Headers

##### Second Level Header
###### Third Level Header

###### Numbered List
```
This is my
Email 4:
Hi Fred, my name is Joe and I'm responsible for shipping for Rob's division. If you have a rate you'd be willing to send, I'd be happy to put the business your way.

  1. First item in the list
  2. Another item
```
```
1. First item in the list
2. Another item
```
##### Code

To format inline code, enclose it in backticks `like this`. To include a literal backtick, precede it with a backslash `like this`.

To format a block of code, indent it by four spaces (standard indentation in Markdown) or surround it with triple backticks ``` .

```javascript
var foo = 'bar';
```
                    ```ruby
class Foo
  def initialize(foo)
    @foo = foo
  end
end
```
# Syntax Highlighting
Email 5:
Hi Fred, here is a link to our Antwerp Sales Rep: http://bit.ly/Antwerp-Sales-Rep                    Feel free to contact him at 0031 (0)62776XXXX and he will help you with your rate.                    Thanks,                    Eric

```

```

# Horizontal Rule
```

```
## Hard Break

Backslash escapes all HTML and Markdown formatting.

Text can be escaped by prefixing it with a backslash \ . It will not be converted.

# Images

input_text:
Email 1:
Hi Alex,                    My buyer here in Oslo needs 600MT of MEG from Houston. Could you please give me a rate estimate for a spot voyage and advise on the signing of a charter party?                    Cheers,                    Kristina
Email 2:
Hi Kristina,                It's in the $90s/ton (FOB Nola) at the moment. Rates are firm at this level, since very few tonnage is being offered. Also, considering the port congestion in Houston, we would only sign a charter party once we have the deal in hand. Should the charter party contain a destination clause, then of course, it could be signed upon final confirmation.               Regards, Alex

Comment:
Notice the commercial terms are spoken in term of shipping industry currency: MT, t, per ton, etc.
Email 3:
Here in Norway, it's our currency, the Krone, that is used. So here goes our deal in the local currency:

3,300,000/MT (FOB Nola)

A charter party may be drawn up to cover our terms. But, if the MEG should arrive a bit early, we could store the cargo until we need it.

Best, Kris.

Comment:
Here we have the commercial terms expressed in terms of "3,300,000/MT" instead of "per ton". In our example, 3,300,000 is the same as $90. The reason for the discrepancy is that Kristina, the seller, is located in Oslo, Norway, and the selling price is denominated in Norwegian Krone (NOK). One NOK equals 0.16 USD.
Email 4:
Hello Mr. Harris,                    It's you again. I received a FOB quotation from a Singaporean trader today, but I am not sure how it compares to what you quoted.                12,000MT of MEG FOB Nola (delivery within 2 weeks).                3,300,000/MT                FOB                             USD 3,300,000                Estimated delivery cost: 20,000                Charter party fee: 200,000                Insurance: 350,000                Total: USD 3,890,000                The above price includes destination clause: "Bill of Lading to be issued 'Norwegian ports only'". So, how does your rate compare?                Best, Kristina                    Post Script: According to my friend who works in the shipping department at the big Norwegian oil company, the port congestion in Houston is due to Hurricane Gustav
output_text:
From: kristina@osloimports.com
To: alex@houstonexports.com
Subject: Inquiry for MEG Spot Voyage Rate from Houston
Timestamp: 2023-01-15 09:00
Body: Hi Alex, my buyer in Oslo is interested in purchasing 600MT of MEG from Houston. Could you provide an estimate for a spot voyage rate and advise on when we can sign a charter party?

---

From: alex@houstonexports.com
To: kristina@osloimports.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry for MEG Spot Voyage Rate from Houston
Timestamp: 2023-01-15 11:30
Body: Hi Kristina, the current FOB New Orleans rate is around $90/ton. Rates are firm at this level due to limited tonnage availability. Additionally, due to port congestion in Houston, we will only sign a charter party once we have finalized the deal. If the charter party needs a destination clause, it can be signed after we confirm the final details.

---

From: kristina@osloimports.com
To: alex@houstonexports.com
Subject: Re: MEG Rate and Contract Details
Timestamp: 2023-01-15 14:20
Body: Thanks for the update, Alex. Here in Norway, we deal in Krone. Thus, the local equivalent price is 3,300,000 NOK/MT (approx. $90/MT translated) (FOB Nola). We can draft a charter party with these terms and provisions for storage if the MEG arrives earlier than needed.

---

From: kristina@osloimports.com
To: alex@houstonexports.com
Subject: Comparison of MEG Rates
Timestamp: 2023-01-15 16:45
Body: Hello Alex, I've received a quotation from a Singaporean trader for 12,000MT of MEG FOB New Orleans at 3,300,000 NOK/MT, USD equivalent of $90/ton. Their offer includes destination clause: 'Bill of Lading to be issued only for Norwegian ports'. Their total calculation with an estimated delivery cost of $20,000, charter party fee of $200,000, and insurance of $350,000 amounts to $3,890,000. Could you let me know how your rate compares? P.S. According to a contact at a major Norwegian oil company, the current port congestion in Houston is due to Hurricane Gustav.

Email 2:
Hi Daniel,                    I'm the bunkering specialist at the shipping company Frachtintra GmbH. We currently have a tanker for sale in Weipa, Australia. The specifications of the tanker are:                    - 5,000 m3                    - LNG + LPG                    - Complies with IMO NOx Tier III/EU IV emissions standards                    - Can carry various liquid chemicals, such as crude oil, petrochemicals, chemicals for industrial uses and more                    The price is 15.5 million USD. Hello Ms. Elsner,                    Could you provide a 1,500MT cargo of freight from Hamburg to Tehran before June 14th? Please share your typical demurrage and dispatch rates.                    Thanks,                    Serafina
Email 2:
Dear Serafina,                      We have available 1,500 MT freight capacity on the Hamburg to Tehran route. We have some cargo from Manila to Hamburg which is now arriving. We can ship to Istanbul with one stop on arrival and to go via Ahvaz to Tehran with one stop on arrival for Iran. It depends on which cargo we will have after landing on Istanbul on May 31st.          The rate is $750 per 20' container demurrage, $500 per 20' container dispatch. Please let me know if you can provide such cargo to us.  Thank you,                               Johann <Email 3>:
Dear Johann,                               Thank you for your offer, but this is not the route we are seeking. We'd like to ship from Hamburg to Tehran. Please let me know if you can do so. Thank you!                               Serafina
Email 3:
Dear Johann,                               Thank you for your offer, but this is not the route we are seeking. We'd like to ship from Hamburg to Tehran. Please let me know if you can do so. Thank you!                               Serafina

<Email 3>:
 Dear Serafina,                               We can take the cargo to Istanbul with one stop on arrival. We have space from Manila to Hamburg. We have one space from Hamburg to Istanbul on May 31st on our vessel ETERNAL DREAM. We can take your cargo from Istanbul to Ahvaz on our vessel METAPHYSICS and go via Ahvaz to Tehran with one stop on arrival.          Thank you,                               Johann

*Source: click here to view the original emails in the attachment
output_text:
From: serafina@example.com
To: johann.elsner@example.com
Subject: Freight Request from Hamburg to Tehran
Timestamp: 2023-05-15 10:00
Body: Hello Ms. Elsner,

Could you provide a 1,500MT cargo of freight from Hamburg to Tehran before June 14th? Please share your typical demurrage and dispatch rates.

Thanks,
Serafina

---

From: johann.elsner@example.com
To: serafina@example.com
Subject: Re: Freight Request from Hamburg to Tehran
Timestamp: 2023-05-16 08:30
Body: Dear Serafina,

We can offer a logistic solution with available 1,500 MT freight capacity on the Hamburg to Tehran route. The cargo will first be transported to Istanbul and then via Ahvaz to Tehran, with planned stops in each city. The cargo transit from Manila to Hamburg will land in Istanbul on May 31st.  Our freight rates are $750 per 20' container for demurrage and $500 per 20' container for dispatch.

Please confirm if this arrangement suits your needs. Thank you!

Best regards,
Johann

---

From: serafina@example.com
To: johann.elsner@example.com
Subject: Re: Freight Request from Hamburg to Tehran
Timestamp: 2023-05-16 12:20
Body: Dear Johann,

Thank you for your offer, but the route described is not what we are seeking. We would like a more direct shipment option from Hamburg to Tehran, without additional stops if possible. Please let me know if such direct service is feasible.

Best regards,
Serafina

---

From: johann.elsner@example.com
To: serafina@example.com
Subject: Re: Freight Request from Hamburg to Tehran
Timestamp: 2023-05-17 09:15
Body: Dear Serafina,

Acknowledging your preference for a direct route, I would like to confirm that we can arrange for your cargo to be transported directly from Hamburg to Tehran with only a single necessary stop in Istanbul for operational purposes. The cargo will be loaded on our vessel ETERNAL DREAM, proceeding from Istanbul to Ahvaz and then Tehran on our vessel METAPHYSICS. Each transfer will be managed to maintain schedule and efficiency.

Thank you for your consideration.

Kind regards,
Johann

Email 2:
Dear Tim,             I'm going to refer to my first email response and elaborate as requested.             We’ve never sold that quantity of MGO. Our company is a division of a larger company that has supplied 100,000mt+ to major trading companies in the last few years, so we can do this. The time frame can be negotiated between the supplier and buyer. We usually provide the shipping documents within 10-12 days of the shipment and request payment in cash 4 weeks later. The buyer needs to pay the bank documentary charges within 2 weeks of the shipment.             I think the real trick is to find a supplier who is able to supply this quantity. To find a supplier for 200,000mt who is able to deliver such a big order is quite challenging. The order should be split into two parts, each part being around 100,000mt.
Email 3:
I’ve just learned that the delivery vessel has a limit of 130,000mt and two big ships might be needed. So, 100,000mt of the order might be enough to fill one ship, and the other ship will have to be loaded with the other 100,000mt.             There are many shipping vessels available that can take this amount of cargo. The average delivery time for this kind of shipment is around 45 days, although it’s possible to shorten the delivery time. It depends on the cargo vessel’s available route.             The costs for this shipment can vary from USD 10 to USD 20 per mt, depending on the size of the cargo vessel, the route taken, and the distance the cargo will have to travel.             In conclusion, I think the best course of action is to ship the order in two parts, each part being around 100
Email 4:
I will continue to provide information on how to find a supplier and transport and shipping companies for this type of shipment.             The best way to find a supplier is to contact the local trade association or trade missions in your area. They can help you find a local supplier, and if there’s no local supplier, they can refer you to the association or missions in the destination country.             There are several types of shipping vessels that can take this amount of cargo. The most common types are bulk carriers, tankers, container ships, and Ro-Ro (Roll-on/roll-off) vessels. Each type of vessel has its own advantages and disadvantages.             The most common route is from Europe to Japan. The distance between the two countries is around 7,000 nautical miles, and the voyage can take around 30 days, depending on the vessel’s speed and the weather.             The average

---

From: capt.hu@email.com
To: timothy@email.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry About Capability and Time Requirement for MGO Cargo Shipment
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 14:12
Body: Dear Timothy, Referring to previous discussions, while we have experience handling shipments exceeding 100,000mt through our parent company to major traders, a 200,000mt order remains substantial. Such orders are typically split, with each part approximating 100,000mt. The timeframe, including shipping documentation and payment schedules, can be negotiated directly between the supplier and the buyer. A crucial factor is finding a supplier capable of fulfilling such a vast quantity. Regards, Capt. Hu

---

From: capt.hu@email.com
To: timothy@email.com
Subject: Additional Details on Shipping Vessels
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 15:45
Body: I’d like to add that the largest vessels available for this route have a capacity limit of 130,000mt, suggesting the necessity for two ships. The average delivery duration is roughly 45 days, although it varies based on the chosen route and vessel availability. Shipping costs are estimated between USD 10 to USD 20 per mt. Splitting the shipment seems the most prudent strategy. Regards, Capt. Hu

To: timothy@email.com

In the absence of local options, these bodies can also refer to international sources. Multiple vessel types, including bulk carriers and tankers, suit this cargo size. The most traveled route between Europe and Japan spans approximately 7,000 nautical miles, with the typical journey lasting about 30 days depending on maritime conditions. Regards, Capt. Hu

The delivery address must be valid, and the documents must be sent to:                    Ms. Joan <email address hidden>                    I hope that is ok.                    Best regards,                    Patrick
Email 3:
Dear Patrick,             No problem, we will deliver it at the port.  It will be in the container.  It is 3 tonnes.             Please let us know when you expect the container to arrive.             Thanks             Stephen

In any dialogue it is important to state facts and not omit or conceal important information. This gives room for miscommunication as well as mistrust between the two sides. That’s why it is important to understand how to communicate professionally in business correspondence.

## What is Business Correspondence?

A message sent and received via a written form is known as a business correspondence. It is crucial as it provides information on the various activities of an organization. There are several forms of business correspondence. They include formal business letters, e-mails, and memos.

The letter types might be used to communicate with customers, clients, or employees. Some examples of business correspondence include application letters
Email 4:
Dear Mr. Kiriil,
We are very pleased to hear that you would like to become a regular customer of ours.  It is unfortunate that we have to turn down your offer due to the company policy.  We are not able to issue you with a regular customer card due to the fact that we do not use regular customer cards.  Our company has its own credit rating system which is used for the purpose of establishing customer loyalty.  In future, we would be able to offer you a credit line which we can tailor to your needs.  We would like to assure you of our continuing cooperation.
Yours sincerely,
Maria
</Email 4>
<Email 5>:
Dear Mr. Christopher,
We regret to inform you that we cannot continue to do business with your company.  We have been consistently dissatisfied with the quality of your products and the after-sales service provided

Email 1:
Hi Ms. Cheng,                    We have an urgent requirement for a tanker to carry 25,000MT of LNG from Lagos to Hong Kong. Would you be able to provide your best freight rate and do you allow re-instatement of laytime beyond 96 hours?                    Thank you,                    Damian
Email 2:
Hi Damian,                    The price is FOB USD540.00/MT, not including the lighering fee (max 5,000mt at $300/mt). Freight time of the vessel in and out of the ports is 4 days, transit time is 27 days.                    Reinstatement for both arrival and departure must be approved. After the vessel have left our port, it cannot get a reinstatement of 48hours, even after 96hours. Arrival time must be within 24 hours, if the vessel will not arrive on time, it can get reinstatement for up to 24 hours. If you want to sign the Charter Party with us, please send us the following documents as soon as possible:                    1. company profile, scope of operation, address, fax number, phone number.                    2. certification of insurance.                    3.
output_text:
From: damian@example.com
To: mscheng@example.com
Subject: Urgent Requirement for Tanker Charter
Timestamp: 2023-09-01 09:12
Body: Hi Ms. Cheng,

We have an urgent requirement for a tanker to carry 25,000MT of LNG from Lagos to Hong Kong. Could you please provide your best freight rate, and clarify if you allow laytime reinstatement beyond 96 hours?

Thank you,
Damian

---

From: mscheng@example.com
To: damian@example.com
Subject: Re: Urgent Requirement for Tanker Charter
Timestamp: 2023-09-01 14:46
Body: Hi Damian,

The freight rate is FOB USD 540.00/MT. This rate does not include the lightering fee, which is applicable for max 5,000MT at $300/MT. The port time for vessel operations is approximately 4 days, and transit time from Lagos to Hong Kong is estimated at 27 days.

Reinstatement of laytime for both arrival and departure must be pre-approved. After the vessel departs, reinstatement cannot exceed 48 hours following the 96-hour mark. For arrivals, if the vessel does not arrive on schedule, laytime reinstatement can be granted for up to an additional 24 hours. Please let me know if you wish to proceed with signing the Charter Party, and kindly send the following documents at your earliest convenience:

1. Company profile, scope of operation, address, fax number, phone number.
2. Certification of insurance.

Thank you,
Ms. Cheng

input_text:
Email 1:
Good day Mr. Xing,                    I have a cargo of 4,000MT of methanol from Corpus Christi to Durban. Can you send a charter cost, and how much for commission?                    Many thanks,                    Fabio
Email 2:
Good day,                        I would like to know if your company has anything going to Asia to book a chartered vessel. I have 2500mt of steel.                    I am looking forward to hearing from you as soon as possible.                    Kind regards,                    Hennie
Email 3:
Dear Sirs,                         I am a buyer with a cargo of 12,500 MT of steel products from Vietnam. I would like to check your company’s capability in providing Vessel Charter.                    Best regards,                    Cindy

They show up in email. When you google “ur5 quickbooks” and “quickbooks error 176109”, you’ll find this email. They are low cost replicas of your computer’s typical shipping and air delivery errors. One reason why they’re so effective is because they’re 100% human-friendly, like “Q: When will the goods arrive? A: Today.”

When you send them back, they’ll respond. These two replies will let you know that someone from them (and not a computer, and certainly not an imposter) is in your inbox.

If you’re not going to send them a reply, or if you’re going to turn
Email 4:
Dear Sirs,                     I am a buyer with a cargo of 12,500 MT of steel products from Vietnam. I would like to check your company’s capability in providing Vessel Charter.                    Best regards,                    Cindy

Email 1:
Hi Ms. Morrow,                    We have just received confirmation for 3,200MT phosphates from Casablanca to Lisbon. Can you confirm your offer to carry this cargo?                    Regards,                    Ishaan
Email 2:
Hi Ishaan,                    Please find attached a Confirmation of Arrival. Can you let us know when this cargo is coming?                    Regards,                    Sarah 

1. Which type of communication did Sarah use in <Email 2>?
Answer: Email

2. What might Sarah's Confirmation of Arrival be?
Answer: A document that outlines information about the shipping procedure for the cargo.
Email 3:
Sarah:                    Hi, Ishaan.                    When will this cargo be arriving? 
                    Ishaan:                    The cargo should be arriving on October 6.                    Are you ready for it? 

3. What type of shipping route is the cargo taking?
Answer: This is a sea route.

4. Why does Sarah ask about the arrival date?
Answer: To plan for the arrival and preparation of the cargo.

<Email 4>:
Sarah:                    Okay, we're all set!                    I'll be expecting the cargo on the 6th of October.                    Ishaan:                    Great! I'll let the ship know.                    Talk to you soon! 

5. What is the reason for this email?
Answer: To confirm the cargo's arrival date and arrange for the cargo's reception.

6. What does "all set" mean in this context?
Answer

Email 1:
Dear Ship Manager,                    We have 11,400MT of feed flour from Haiphong to Singapore. Could you let us know if your vessel is open in the next 3 days, and what’s your policy on laytime extensions?                    Sincerely,                    Mandy
Email 2:
I would like to know if your vessel can load for the cargo as below,                              Load at      Unload at      Dest.      Cargo      US$/MT      Temp          Quantity
Haiphong         Port Bellingham        FOB      Wheat Flour           240     15%            11,400MT

<Email 3>:
We will load 11,400MT of Wheat flour at Haiphong port and discharge at Port Bellingham FOB. The approximate draft for arrival at Haiphong is 14.5 m (max draft 15.5 m), and the capacity of your vessel at Haiphong is 11,900MT, so there will be 500MT difference in the contract quantity, we can do the contract for 11,900MT, then the invoice of 11,900MT is the net payable amount. For draft
output_text:
From: mandy@example.com
To: shipmanager@example.com
Subject: Inquiry about Vessel Availability and Laytime Policy for Cargo Transport
Timestamp: 2023-05-01 08:30
Body: Dear Ship Manager,

We are looking to ship 11,400MT of Wheat Flour from Haiphong to Singapore shortly. Can you please confirm if your vessel is available in the next 3 days? Additionally, we would appreciate details on your policy regarding laytime extensions.

Thank you.
Sincerely,
Mandy

---

From: mandy@example.com
To: shipmanager@example.com
Subject: Clarification on Load and Discharge Ports for Wheat Flour Cargo
Timestamp: 2023-05-01 09:15
Body: Dear Ship Manager,

I would like to clarify the details of our intended cargo transfer. We plan to load 11,400MT of Wheat Flour at Haiphong and discharge at Singapore, not Port Bellingham as erroneously mentioned in my previous email. Could you confirm the loading capacity and provide a freight quote per metric ton?

Best regards,
Mandy

---

From: shipmanager@example.com
To: mandy@example.com
Subject: Re: Cargo Capacity and Draft Details at Haiphong
Timestamp: 2023-05-01 10:05
Body: Hello Mandy,

Thank you for your questions. Our vessel can handle up to 11,900MT at Haiphong, with a maximum draft of 15.5 m. The draft upon arrival would be approximately 14.5 m. Given the cargo specifications you provided, we are able to accommodate the full 11,900MT. Thus, the invoice would reflect a net payable amount for 11,900MT. Please confirm if you would like to proceed with this adjustment.

Best regards,
Ship Manager

From: fred@shippingcompany.com
To: info@cargotrans.com
Subject: Enquiry for Vessel Charter: Santos, Brazil to Lomé, Togo
Timestamp: 2016-09-01 09:30
Body: Hi,

Would you mind assisting us with the charter for transporting 22,000MT of Ro-Ro Iron Ore from Santos, Brazil to Lomé, Togo?

Here are the details:
- Port of Loading: Santos, Brazil
- Discharge Port: Lomé, Togo
- Loading date: September 16, 2016
- Discharge date: September 30, 2016
- Laycan: October/November 2016
- Vessel required: Handysize bulk carrier for single vessel transportation.
- Special equipment or requirement: Deck load of 20MT/m2 with 4.5 m on centre line and 2 m side shift.

Owners will manage all charter party and commercial documents. The minimum charter period is 18 days.

Could you please confirm your availability and provide your earliest and best offer?

Regards,
Fred

---

From: info@cargotrans.com
To: fred@shippingcompany.com
Subject: Re: Enquiry for Vessel Charter: Santos, Brazil to Lomé, Togo
Timestamp: 2016-09-02 10:15
Body: Dear Fred,

Thank you for your inquiry. We are based in Singapore and offer extensive services in cargo brokerage and chartering. For further processing of your request, could you please confirm if the information below is correct?
- Port of Loading: Santos, Brazil
- Discharge Port: Lomé, Togo
- Estimated Loading & Discharge Dates: September 16, 2016 & September 30, 2016 respectively 
- Vessel Type: Handysize bulk carrier
- Could you also provide the B/L copy and load port documentation?
- Is there any insurance or marine pollution risk involved with the cargo?
- Minimum charter period: 18 days
- Any specific instructions for cargo handling & delivery?

Looking forward to your confirmation to proceed.

Best regards,
Cargotrans Team

---

From: junwu@cargotrans.com
To: fred@shippingcompany.com
Subject: Confirmation of Vessel Charter Details
Timestamp: 2016-09-03 11:00
Body: Dear Fred,

Greetings from the CARGOTRANS team in Shenzhen, China!

Thank you for your email. We have reviewed the provided information and can proceed with the following terms:
- Loading Port: Santos, Brazil
- Discharging Port: Lomé, Togo
- Loading Date: September 16, 2016
- Discharging Date: October 17, 2016 (revised from your original request)
- Vessel Type: Handysize Bulker
- Cargo Type: Ro-Ro Iron Ore
- The owner will handle all charter party & commercial documents.
- Deck Load Specification: 20MT/m2 with space for 4.5 m on the centerline and 2 m side shift.

Please review and let us know if you have any changes or additional requests.

Best regards,
Jun Wu

---

From: fred@shippingcompany.com
To: shanghaiteam@cargotrans.com

Thank you for the details. I've noted the adjusted discharging date and will discuss it internally. Meanwhile, I have forwarded your information to our team in Shanghai. They will follow up with you directly. I am also sending you a business card for future reference.

Thank you.
Fred

input_text:
Email 1: What's the current status of the vessel? Any news you can share? Best, Nada Email 2: Welcome to Sada, Here are the latest developments on Almarakib.

Outward bound.

Two reasons. 1. Almarakib's Pakistani captain is low on funds and is able to transport items from our port to Pakistan and earn some quick cash. He's a freelancer by nature, and is more than happy to take on whatever job comes his way as long as he gets his money upfront.

2. He is asking for $30,000 upfront. We will take out a loan for the money. We cannot afford the loan. I must sell off my share of the ship to pay it back.

I am writing this email on my phone from the bank.

I have agreed to let the bank have your share of the ship and pay off the loan.
output_text:
From: nada@example.com
To: sada@example.com
Subject: Status Update Needed on Vessel
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 09:00
Body: What's the current status of the vessel? Any news you can share?
Best,
Nada

---

From: sada@example.com
To: nada@example.com
Subject: Re: Status Update Needed on Vessel
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 11:30
Body: Hello Nada,

Here are the latest developments regarding the vessel Almarakib:

The vessel is currently outward bound, and there are two main reasons for this development:
1. The Captain, who is Pakistani, is low on funds. He has decided to transport items from our port to Pakistan as a freelance venture to quickly earn some cash. He insists on receiving $30,000 upfront.
2. To accommodate his upfront payment request, we would need to take out a loan. Unfortunately, we cannot afford to cover this loan on our own. I'm considering selling my share of the ship to repay the loan.

I'm currently at the bank handling these affairs and have agreed to let the bank claim your share of the ship and use it to handle the loan repayment.

Best regards,
Sada

From: olivia@example.com
To: anderson@example.com
Subject: Request for Shipping Quote
Timestamp: 2023-03-01 09:30
Body: Mr. Anderson, Would you please provide a quote for our shipment of 10,000MT of M.G. wheat from Dalian to Durban. Can you include any extra charges for overweight or additional services? Thank you, Olivia

---

From: olivia@example.com
To: martin@example.com
Subject: Charter Inquiry - Dalian to Durban
Timestamp: 2023-03-02 08:15
Body: Mr. Martin, Thank you for your quote of $7,350. Considering the premium quality of our MG wheat, this offers great value. I understand your vessel is currently scheduled to head to Australia, but could we arrange for it to load from your current location, possibly London, and then proceed to Dalian? This arrangement could significantly reduce our costs. Look forward to your advice. Regards, Olivia

---

From: martin@example.com
To: olivia@example.com
Subject: Re: Charter Inquiry - Dalian to Durban
Timestamp: 2023-03-03 10:00
Body: Ms. Olivia, Thank you for considering our service. Unfortunately, rerouting from London to Dalian directly isn't feasible at the moment due to our commitments. However, I'm exploring alternatives and will update you soon. Best, Martin

---

From: james@example.com
To: anderson@example.com
Subject: Freight Quote Consideration
Timestamp: 2023-03-04 13:20
Body: Mr. Anderson, We find your quote for $6,500 very attractive. We are holding the quote open until the end of the week to allow time for our enquiry to be approved. Thank you, James

---

From: olivia@example.com
To: martin@example.com
Subject: Revised Quote Follow-Up
Timestamp: 2023-03-05 14:50
Body: Mr. Martin, We note your revised quote is less competitive than your original quote of $7,350. As per our initial enquiry, we are striving for the best value for our wheat shipment. We still hold your initial quote of $7,350 open for the time being. Regards, Olivia

---

To: anderson@example.com
Subject: Confirmation of Vessel Availability
Timestamp: 2023-03-06 09:45
Body: Mr. Anderson, Please confirm the availability of a suitable vessel to load at Dalian to deliver to Durban. Can you provide us with your General Conditions of Charter and Charter Party for our approval? Thank you, Daniel

From: carina@example.com
To: peter@example.com
Subject: Inquiry: Vessel Availability for Clinker Transport
Timestamp: 2023-07-01 09:00
Body: Peter,

Would your vessel be able to transport 8,000MT of clinker from Dubai to Dar es Salaam in early August? Can you also provide how much time in advance we need to book the ship? Additionally, will you be able to handle a return load to Dubai?

Regards,
Carina

---

From: peter@example.com
To: carina@example.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel Availability for Clinker Transport
Timestamp: 2023-07-01 10:45
Body: Carina,

Hi. Thank you for reaching out. Can you confirm the value per MT for the clinker? Also, yes, arranging a return load to Dubai after unloading at Dar es Salaam is possible.

Best,
Peter

---

From: carina@example.com
To: peter@example.com
Subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel Availability for Clinker Transport
Timestamp: 2023-07-01 11:30
Body: Peter,

The clinker is valued at about 2,500 USD per MT. Thanks for confirming the return load. I look forward to your vessel availability details.

Regards,
Carina

---

From: carina@example.com
To: peter@example.com
Subject: Additional Details: Clinker Storage and Transport
Timestamp: 2023-07-01 11:35
Body: Peter,

To clarify, the clinker will be stored in bulk. Please consider this for the vessel arrangements.

Thanks,
Carina

---

From: carina@example.com
To: peter@example.com
Subject: Further Details: Clinker Transport Requirement
Timestamp: 2023-07-02 08:00
Body: Peter,

To further specify, we will need a 25,000 dwt vessel. Would you be able to load 10,000MT at the beginning in Dubai and then complete the loading with 8,000MT at Dar es Salaam?

Regards,
Carina

---

From: peter@example.com
To: carina@example.com
Subject: Re: Further Details: Clinker Transport Requirement
Timestamp: 2023-07-02 09:15
Body: Carina,

I apologize for the delayed response as I am currently attending a conference. I need to check the availability of a suitable 25,000 dwt vessel. I will get back to you as soon as possible.

Regards,
Peter

Hi Fiona,                    Unfortunately we can not supply bauxite from Wando to Cagliari right now.                    Hope you are well!                    Terrence

#Create a Chat Bot

A bot is an automated process that performs an action for you. You can send it a message and it will respond to your message and take action on your behalf. A Chat Bot is an example of a bot.

To create a chat bot we will be making a Github Repository, to use NodeJS, this is because:

• NodeJS is one of the most popular languages used in web development today.
• NodeJS allows you to run your code server-side, which means it can process data and respond to user interactions in real time.
• NodeJS also supports JavaScript, which is a great way to get started with programming. It's an easy language to learn, and many developers already know it.
•

Dear Mr. Smith,                    Your new C-Flex 1100 vessels have arrived at Ningbo Port. Would you like to charter this for our next shipment of cargo from Ningbo to Hai Phong? It’s a 4,000 tons shipment of polystyrene.                    When do you plan to start delivery?                    Regards,                    Violet
Email 2:
Dear Ms. Violet,                    Our C-Flex 1100 vessels have indeed arrived. They can be chartered for your next shipment of cargo from Ningbo to Hai Phong. What is the shipment’s ETA?                    I’ll need you to give us more information about the shipment, like:                    * The cargo’s name, weight, and volume (in cubic meters)                    * Any hazardous materials on board                    * Cargo description                    * Cargo price                    * Lashing for securing the cargo                    * More requirements (like reefer containers for cargoes that need a particular temperature for preservation, etc.)                    We can make a quotation when we have all the required details.                    I’ll be waiting for your reply.                    Regards,                    Alwin

output_text:
From: violet@cargoimporters.com
To: mr.smith@shippingcompany.com
Subject: Charter Inquiry for C-Flex 1100 Vessels
Timestamp: 2023-09-01 08:30
Body: Dear Mr. Smith,

Your new C-Flex 1100 vessels have arrived at Ningbo Port. I am interested in chartering one for our next shipment of cargo from Ningbo to Hai Phong. The shipment consists of 4,000 tons of polystyrene. Could you please let us know the earliest possible start date for delivery?

Regards,
Violet

---

From: mr.smith@shippingcompany.com
To: violet@cargoimporters.com
Subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for C-Flex 1100 Vessels
Timestamp: 2023-09-01 12:05
Body: Dear Ms. Violet,

Thank you for your inquiry. Our C-Flex 1100 vessels are indeed available and can be chartered for your shipment from Ningbo to Hai Phong. To provide you with a detailed quotation, could you please provide the following additional details about the shipment?

- Shipment Volume (in cubic meters)
- Presence of any hazardous materials
- Detailed cargo description
- Cargo value
- Requirements for lashing to secure the cargo
- Any specific requirements such as reefer containers, etc.

I'll be waiting for your reply to proceed with the quotation.

Regards,
Alwin

input_text:
Email 1:
Hi Daniel,                    Could you let us know what the earliest possible dates are for shipping 3000MT of turpentine from Durban to Alexandria. We don’t need FOB, but we’d like to fix rates asap.                    Best,                    Andre
Email 2:
Just want to let you know that both emails (1 & 2) were recieved at the same time (23:42). 
NB: I was sitting in my office in South Africa when the above email arrived. So no email delay, no delay in me seeing the email, no delay in me writing the email.
Email 3:
Hi Andre,                    Just to reiterate: I did not write Email 2 - I did not exist at the time Email 2 was written. 
                    Do you want me to believe that? or do you want to apologize and accept that you made a mistake?
Email 4:
<removed> let me know. You could say, for instance, you wrote email 3 in a hurry, when you were not at your best. 
<I did> 
                    I didn't exist at the time. In terms of your earlier comment, "No, Daniel. I did not exist then. I could not have written it then." Just to say that we know that you were the one who wrote the email. There is no dispute about that. It's your name on the email. There is a difference between what you wrote and what you did. 
                    That's fair enough. My other reason for contacting you was to discuss the statement on our website, where it says: "We don't have access to the rest of the page of letters." 
                    I just want to let you know, as I can see from your first response here (Response #1)
output_text:
From: andre@example.com
To: daniel@example.com
Subject: Request for Shipping Rates and Dates
Timestamp: 2023-09-12 08:15
Body: Hi Daniel,
Could you let us know the earliest possible dates for shipping 3000MT of turpentine from Durban to Alexandria? We don’t need FOB terms, but we’d like to fix the rates as soon as possible.
Best regards,
Andre

---

From: daniel@example.com
To: andre@example.com
Subject: Re: Receipt of Your Request
Timestamp: 2023-09-12 23:42
Body: Hi Andre,
Just to confirm, I have received your email regarding the shipping of turpentine. I was at my office in South Africa when I received it, and there has been no delay in this correspondence. I will review the details and get back to you shortly with the available shipping dates and rates.
Best regards,
Daniel

---

From: andre@example.com
To: daniel@example.com
Subject: Clarification Needed
Timestamp: 2023-09-13 09:07
Body: Hi Daniel,
Just to clarify, my initial email is the only one I sent. I believe there's been a misunderstanding because there seems to be a reference to another email, which I did not send. Could you please confirm?
Thanks,
Andre

---

From: daniel@example.com
To: andre@example.com
Subject: Re: Clarification Needed
Timestamp: 2023-09-13 09:55
Body: Hi Andre,
Apologies for any confusion. I understand now that you did not send another email. Thank you for the clarification. I will proceed with your initial request and provide the necessary information on shipping rates and possible dates as soon as possible.
Thank you for your patience,
Daniel

To: Cuenca, Paul
Subject: RE: Free 50ft Container
Date: Wednesday, February 17, 2010 11:38:01 AM
Great - you book a 50-foot container, which is not in our scope! Are you sure we have a 50-foot container deal with you? If we had a 50-foot container deal with you, I would've thought you would've offered us the container first because we are an origin based company. Also, I'm not sure what 'book' means in this context. There are not many 50-foot container companies in Canada and if we had a deal with you, I would be sure about that.

Neeta

Yes, we will book it as you wish. We will also book the 20ft container for you, however, we need to move it as a OOG from the main line to the OOCL main line. Paul
